passages.text: Reiterating OW and Top Pick in Mexico; Establishing Ps 75 PT for Dec- 26

We reiterate our positive view on Megacable, which is our top pick in Mexican TMT, as we see capacity utilization in the new network growing and capex declining, paving the way for improved cash flow generation. We update our estimates and price target to account for: (1) lower capex and higher number of homes passed; (2) a more moderate view on growth and specifically margin expansion into 2026, given the tough competitive environment; (3) lower WACC, at \(11.7\%\) vs \(12.0\%\) previously; and (4) the rollover effect of the target. All in all, we are establishing a Ps 75 target for Dec- 26, which compares to our previous Dec- 25 PT of Ps 63, suggesting \(37\%\) potential upside.

- Reducing capex and increasing homes passed. In line with management's guidance, we expect capex to close the year at between \(27 - 28\%\) of revs, below the initial \(28\%\) guidance, which prompts us to cut capex by \(-2.6\% / - 3\%\) for 25E/26E. Moreover, we assume 1m homes passed per year after 2026, which management claims to be doable under the capex budget of \(-20\%\) of revs.

- Taking a more moderate view on 2026 due to competition. AMX's (N) stance on keeping nominal prices could put some pressure on Megacable, which in turn might have to invest more to achieve the desired growth. While we believe Mega should be able to deliver 100-150k net adds per quarter for the next two years, we tone down our estimates, tilting Net Revenues by \(+0.8\% / - 3.0\%\) for 25E/26E, and EBITDA by \(-1.0\% / - 4.0\% \).

- Valuation: Mega trades below its LatAm peers in 2025 and 2026. The stock trades at \(4.4x\) EV/EBITDA 25E and \(4.0x\) 26E, while AMX trades at \(5.4x / 4.9x\) , Vivo at \(5.9\) , \(5.4x\) , Tigo at \(5.6x / 5.5x\) , and Tim at \(5.1x / 4.6x\) . Nonetheless, Megacable offers superior growth opportunities as it has significant space to increase penetration in its new network.
- We reiterate our OW on Megacable, which is our preferred stock within the Mexican TMT sector, followed by Opsimex (OW), TV(OW) and then AMX(N).

We rate Megacable OW as we believe its plan to double its HPs footprint will generate value above its cost of capital. The company is well positioned to enter new markets without sacrificing margins considering they are aiming at markets that already have higher ARPUs vs. the company as it is. This also suggests that if peers want to enter MEGA markets, they would likely have to compete on price, which is not likely, in our view.
Our Dec- 26 price target of Ps 75 is derived from a DCF- based model, employing an \(11.7\%\) WACC in Mexican pesos and \(- 0.5\%\) long- term real growth.

We are making slight changes to our estimates, with Mass market revs adjusted by 0.5%/-1.4% for 25E/26E. We are lowering our Net Revenue estimate by -0.8%/-3.0%for 25E/26E, and revising down our EBITDA by -1.0%/-4.0%, on a more moderate view on competition. The operational revision comes from Homes Passed expectations up 5%/10% for 2025E/2026E and reduction in Capex by -2.6%/-3.0% for 25E/26E.
Table 1: Change in Estimates
Source: J.P. Morgan estimates.
Megacable (Overweight; Price Target: Ps75.00)

We rate Megacable OW as we believe its plan to double its HPs footprint will generate value above its cost of capital. The company is well positioned to enter new markets without sacrificing margins considering they are aiming at markets that already have higher ARPUs vs. the company as it is. This also suggests that if peers want to enter MEGA markets, they would likely have to compete on price, which is not likely, in our view.
Our Dec- 26 price target of Ps 75 is derived from a DCF- based model, employing an \(11.7\%\) WACC in Mexican pesos and \(- 0.5\%\) long- term real growth.

The chart(s) show J.P. Morgan's continuing coverage of the stocks; the current analysts may or may not have covered it over the entire period. J.P. Morgan ratings or designations: OW = Overweight, N = Neutral, UW = Underweight, NR = Not Rated

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. In our Asia (ex-Australia and ex-India) and U.K. small- and mid- cap Equity Research, each stock's expected total return is compared to the expected total return of a benchmark country market index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
